news.title: New Stars DevLog #11 - Galactic Federations, Unified Fleets, and more...
news.author: adamjr
news.contents:
In Part 2 of the 'Interstellar' update, more playmodes are added with the addition of galactic unions - inspired by Stellaris federations, and stealth fleets. Unite the galaxy with Alliance Builders, or build mighty military fleets with Cooperative Militarists.

Unions: GALACTIC FEDERATIONS


Unions are like 'federations' from Stellaris but are more refined and straightforward. They are an alliance that multiple empires can join, instead of just two. Note that regular bidirectional alliances remain in the game at this time.
  
1) Diplomatic Union

This union focuses on diplomacy and alliance building, forging strong diplomatic ties and leveraging collective strength for mutual benefit. Only alliance builders can form this type of union.
  
Ability: Peaceful star clans can join union.

[expand type=details]
Member Bonuses:

Defensive Pact: Join all ally offensive wars.
Joint Wars: Join all ally defensive wars.
Modifiers: +25% Starbase Strength.
[/expand]
2) Martial Union

This union emphasizes cooperative militarism, combining military prowess with cooperative efforts to defend and expand their territories. Only cooperative militarists can form this type of union.
  
Ability: Build and maintain a union fleet.

The leader can build and maintain union fleets, and they have no size restrictions.
Union Naval Capacity

- 20% of collective member naval capacity.
- This is a hard limit, and cannot be exceeded when building fleets.
[expand type=details]
Member Bonuses:

Defensive Pact: Join all ally offensive wars.
Joint Wars: Join all ally defensive wars.
Modifiers: +25% Ship Build speed.
[/expand]
3) Economic Union

This union revolves around economic dominance, with powerful megacorporations controlling trade and resources to maximize profit and influence. Only megacorporations can form this type of union.
  
Ability: All members have partnerships with each other.

- Partnerships are formed if player forms/joins union.
- Partnerships remain if player leaves union.
[expand type=details]
Member Bonuses:

Defensive Pact: Join all ally offensive wars.
Joint Wars: Join all ally defensive wars.
Modifiers: +25% Collection Value in systems.
[/expand]
Unions: Actions

Form Union - Found a union (must have cooperative ethics).
Leave Union - Leave union (as member).
Join Union - Join union with invite (as non-member).
Kick Player - Kick player from union (as leader).
Invite Player - Invite player to union (as leader).
Request to Join - Request to join union (as non-member).
Accept Request - Accept non-member join request (as leader).
Modify Union - Customize union (as leader).
Considerations:
- Only cooperative governments can found unions.
- Isolationists cannot join unions.
- Joining a union will disband all of the founder's alliances.
- A union must have at least 2 members to exist.
- Founder stays leader, unless they leave or are defeated.
[hr][/hr]

Alliance Builder: UNITE THE GALAXY


The Alliance Builder is a diplomatic powerhouse, specializing in forging alliances, maintaining diplomatic relations, and leveraging collective strength for mutual benefit.
  
Empire Chat:
  
Ability: UNITE THE GALAXY

Can ally and invite star clans to your union.

  
[expand type=details]
Strength: Enhances galactic security, and allies enter all wars.
Weakness: Can be countered by other galactic unions, and you can be dragged into wars.
[/expand]
Ability: FORM DIPLOMATIC UNION

Can form diplomatic unions.

- You can ally star clans, or invite them to your union.
- Star clans are peaceful ancient mini-empires that are open to tribute, but have limited diplomacy.
Unique Building: Unity Council Chambers

This grand structure serves as the central hub for fostering collaboration, forging alliances, and promoting unity among diverse factions within the colony.
[expand type=details]
  
Jobs: 1x Diplomat (Produces: +1 Power)
Bonus: +50 Opinion for all allies.
Restrictions: Non-stackable; Non-upgradable; Can only be built in capital.
Within the spacious halls of the Unity Council Chambers, representatives from various factions convene to discuss matters of common interest, negotiate treaties, and resolve conflicts through diplomatic means. The building houses meeting rooms equipped with advanced communication technologies, translation systems, and data networks to facilitate effective and efficient dialogue between different species and civilizations.
[/expand]
[hr][/hr]

Cooperative Militarist: A UNITED FRONT


Forging a unique path between cooperation and aggression, the Cooperative Militarist emerges as a formidable force on the galactic stage.
  
Empire Chat:
  
Ability: A UNITED FRONT

Can invite other empires to join your wars.

  
[expand type=details]
Strength: Can cause chaos for victim empire.
Weakness: Must have good relations with other players.
[/expand]
Ability: FORM MARTIAL UNION

Can form martial unions.

Unique Building: FORGE MATRIX

Built upon a foundation of shared purpose and coordinated efforts, the Forge Matrix serves as the epitome of the Cooperative Militarist's commitment to collective strength and rapid mobilization.
[expand type=details]
  
Jobs: 1x Forge Technician (Produces: +6 Metals, -3 Energy)
Bonus: +50% Ship Build Speed in system.
Restrictions: Non-stackable; Non-upgradable.
Through meticulous planning and relentless innovation, the Cooperative Militarist has fine-tuned the operations of the Forge Matrix to perfection. Its advanced algorithms optimize resource allocation, minimize production bottlenecks, and streamline the construction process, allowing for an unprecedented increase in fleet build speed within the system.
[/expand]
[hr][/hr]
Quality of Life Improvements

Special Abilities are Shown on Loading Screen

- Shown when initially starting game, instead of tips.
  
[hr][/hr]
Other Changes

1) Repeatable techs are much less likely to show up.
- Non-repeatable techs will be prioritized before repeatables.
2) Leaving an alliance or union forms a 5 year truce.
3) All players can form a business partnership, which now shares 5% of collected resources between empires.
- Previously, this was limited to megacorps, and didn't include trade a bonus.
- This is now mutually beneficial, and can be seen as more of a fixed trade deal.
- Collected resources refers to harvested star/planet resources.
4) Buildings now have custom names, lore, and descriptions.
More to come...

I believe it's more fun for each play-mode to have powerful abilities and mechanics, that can be overpowered in some instances, instead of simply having boring modifiers like '+100% Collection Value'.
Higher quality features will also mean a better overall experience, at the cost of more months before public playtesting. I originally intended for public playtesting in April, but the game won't be ready for that for a while due to an increased scope of game, and thus more development requirements. I expect that this will be the most important gameplay update for the game, and the new features being added are necessary for New Stars to be a fun and replayable experience.
There is still more to come...
[hr][/hr]
Stay tuned for more updates...

Feel free to comment your suggestions below.
🎮 Playtest New Stars:    discord.io/adamjr   .
⭐ Wishlist New Stars to support development.
This page is intended to be a development preview, which may not reflect the final state of the game.
Credits:
-    Star satellites icon by Lorc under CC BY 3.0

news.title: Dev Log More Vampires
news.author: danacraig78
news.contents:
I have finished redoing the Vampire Dungeon scene for Day 1. The set I had used in the previous one was...ok. However, I found a set that had a much better feel, and didn't just repeat the "Grand Inquisition" dungeon I had used for Andrei Prologue and The Council chapter. Also finished a scene that explains the mech that was in the previous version (and still in this. When I have a chance to use a large creature like the Deathstalker, I will use it to tell a story ;))
Now, I am going to work the Lucia portion of the backstory. Up to now, you have seen her briefly in Kei's prologue and Andrei's prologue. I did this intentionally so I could have an opportunity to flesh her out a little more..which I am going to do now. ;)

news.title: Massive update alert: Counting Down to Steam Release
news.author: BRANE
news.contents:
Today is a great point in development of MoC: Demo is feature complete.
Today I've uploaded a new build of Master of Chess demo. If you're interested in testing it, join discord here:   LINK   Is it perfect? No. Is it bug-free? No way. But it's a valid reference point to what the demo will look like when it hits Steam.
  

The Latest and Greatest: What's New in the Demo?


  • Create your player feature is integrated completely. Feel free to start up the demo and create your own player.
  • Match preview screen got a complete overwrite. The placeholder UI is now replaced with a full overview of both players strengths and winning percentages.
  • 'Game crashes randomly' bug fixed! (or so I hope, I can't reproduce it any more!) It seems to be related to the way async code was handled in Godot and in the newest version 4.1 I had to switch the way async code is handled and even clear out some of the async logic.
  • As mentioned, game is now migrated to beta version of Godot 4.1. We're running it bleeding edge as far as Godot is concerned. I'm really happy that Godot will hit stable 4.1 in the approximately same time as my game starts seeking stability too.
  • A linux build! I decided to have a linux build because a) people asked for it, b) I hoped it would give me more insights into some game-crashing bugs.
  • Numerous little bug fixes and tidy ups. I plan to write this up in a more professional manner in the future so I can list those out easily.

A Few Dragons Still to Slay: Current Issues


  • Chess AI Improvements: Chess AI received a lot of comments, with some finding it too challenging and others finding it not challenging enough. This feedback isn't contradictory; it points to the inconsistencies in the AI, which I'm aware of. Over the next week (and even month), refining the AI will be a major focus of my work.
  • Enhancing User Interface: The user experience on the match review screen isn't the best. Navigating through a completed match should be a breeze, and I agree that there's room for improvement. I'm committed to making this experience better. Some UX issues, bugs still exist on the main match screen too. These need to be addressed.
  • AI Responsiveness Issues: Some of you have encountered a problem where the AI stops making moves. This was an issue I tackled in early builds, but it seems to have reappeared. It's time I dive into it and ensure it's permanently fixed.


What's next?

As mentioned, the Demo is feature complete and all that's left is to polish it up. If I could get the AI to be decent enough in the next week and add some Quality of Life improvements then all would be ready for a Steam release of the Demo in early July.
I'm so excited!

news.title: At the Dream End 2 - Beyond Gods DEMO is now available on Steam!
news.author: MMM games
news.contents:
The demo for "At the Dream End 2" has been released on Steam! The demo offers a glimpse into the world of "At the Dream End 2".
And now when the demo is released we are looking for your feedback.
Your opinion is very important to us. We appreciate your feedback because it helps us hone and improve the game before its full release. We invite you to try out the demo and let us know what you think. We are curious to know what you think of the gameplay, graphics, story, and any other aspect. Please take a moment to let us know what you think in the community forums on Steam, on our social media pages, or any other platform of your choice. Your suggestions will be used to improve "At the Dream End 2" and give all players the best experience.
Thank you for your support and enthusiasm. We look forward to hearing from you and working together to create an unforgettable gaming experience. Stay tuned for more updates and news about the game as we continue on this exciting journey together.

news.title: Three Kingdoms Zhao Yun DemoV0.3.6 Update
news.author: Jean
news.contents:
2023/6/25 update :
1. The mouse operation mode is initially provided, which can be used as an early experience, but further debugging is required, press the C key to switch
2. Enhanced compatibility with the English version
3. Fixed the bug that the addition of some buff attributes was reduced
4. Fixed the bug that you can't talk to npc when dismounting
5. When encountering an air wall and turning back automatically, the situation of walking into enemy soldiers is reduced
6. Minor revisions to the difficulty of combat values to avoid being too simple
7. Reduced the situation where Bosses such as Wen Chou will follow the direction when casting skills
8. Fixed the bug of store page
Three Kingdoms Zhao Yun has now entered the optimization stage, and plans to release in the third quarter.
Cheers,
ETime Studio

news.title: [Archive] Experimentation and Retries
news.author: REMORE
news.contents:
※ Spoiler Alert! This is a continuation of a previous    Dev Note   .
We previously talked about our paper prototype being based on Zombicide, the first non-grid turn based version of the game, and the grid semi-turn-based system where all allies acted autonomously.
The goal of the third version was to increase tactical depth by directly controlling all allies while maintaining the grid-based system. However, we were concerned that if we added infiltration mechanics such as "line of sight/sound" on top of the grid turn-based system, the game would become overly complex.
Also, in order to emphasize the thematic feeling of exploring various abandoned buildings and searching for supplies, the battlefield size was quite large at this point. Feedback was given that moving each character one by one could potentially make the flow of the game monotonous given this map size.
Drawing inspiration from games such as Mutant Year Zero and Divinity: Original Sin, which have exploration phases in real-time and combat phases in turn-based mode, we experimented with a version that provides an experience similar to real-time infiltration games during regular movement, and only allows direct commands to be given to all characters during combat.
  
  
This version got close to the desired experience generally. During the exploration phase, we were able to maintain tension by avoiding the attention of randomly moving creatures and searching for supplies. In combat, we were able to focus on tactical gameplay based on striking enemies from out of sight.
However, there was doubt as to whether we could achieve the desired level of quality going in this direction.
Making both "real-time exploration" and "turn-based combat” really enjoyable differed in terms of artwork, game rules, balancing, and other aspects. We felt that if we tried to capture both aspects, there was a high possibility of ending up with mediocre results on both sides.
  
Based on the results of the experiments, we decided to make "integrating all intended gameplay, including movement/exploration, into a turn-based system" the design foundation, even if there were some drawbacks. In a way, if we had just adopted the grid method by itself in the first version, we would have arrived at our current direction earlier, but we took the scenic route instead!
After deciding on this foundation, we fixed the overarching genre characteristics while shifting the focus of prototyping to answering the question, "How can we incorporate elements such as line of sight/sound into a Tactics RPG?" We talked about this in the Dev Note about line of sight and sound.
In addition to this, before reaching our current state, there have been other various iterations in regard to changes in character professions, meta-game and storytelling methods, and more. If we have the chance, we may introduce these at a later date.

Next time, we will briefly summarize how we plan to incorporate many of the suggestions you provided at Steam Next Fest 2023 going forward. See you again next week!
Thank you

news.title: Development Report No. 1
news.author: LMODE
news.contents:
With Regards to Art & Level Direction
The game's development progress is consistent and we are currently overhauling the player's diegetic HUD to a near final state. Once overhauled, we will be ready for all new preview content for an updated store page and marketing push.
A lot of work has been made since the pre-alpha announcement in February. The levels are what take a lot of time, as they are relatively large and must accommodate for multiple paths which lead to different exits. Because it's an underwater game, I am trying to dispel the aversion many people might have with the concept of navigating inside of fog-obscured environments. Silhouettes play a major factor in what you're identifying, so all the levels need an art detail pass which means mostly bespoke layers upon layers of interesting geologies and recognizable landmarks within each of these large levels.
The ecosystem between levels is another thing that needs special attention. I'm not sure how many beasties the final game will have exactly, but the number of unique beasties spawned to make up each level's ecosystem will not be padded out by duplicate geometry with different textures applied. This means that all beasties in the game will have their own recognizable silhouettes which can be identified. So far, there are over 100 unique creatures.
I am also making sure the texture work for everything exists and is well made so that when you are up close to something and turn on your flashlight, you see a level of detail which many may not expect - like strata in rock or the flesh of a jelly. I say this because I do not want the fog to necessarily "hide" anything other than as it pertains to actual navigational gameplay and the use of HUD instruments as a result. And also secrets.
But What About the Gameplay
Closed alpha playtesting has been ongoing and we have made fundamental changes to the game's design and play cycle since our original inception based on this feedback. More details will be revealed as to the specifics of what the gameplay is about later - when we update the store page to give a more concise idea of what the game will actually be like to potential customers.

news.title: Bug Fixes
news.author: company
news.contents:
Thanks for the bug notes on the forums! I've been working to resolve some of the issues folks were seeing on some machines. I just pushed some updates that should take care of:
* Black Screen bug (UI is visible but the game isn't)
* Skipping bug (Nemo appears to glitch as he's walking)
There are also some minor level improvements, performance improvements, and minor changes to things like enemy placement and improving overall playability of the demo level.
Thanks for all the feedback so far! We really appreciate it!
- Ben

news.contents:
Hello everyone,

The wait is over! I am proudly presenting my new title called Ayako's Mission which is recently launched on Steam! If you are into 2D top down arcade shoot'em ups you might enjoy the game.

Check it out here:

Ayako's Mission is a 2D Top-Down Shoot'em Up game based on the story of the war breaking out between the two territories called, AY Corp and ATO Corp. where you must defend your territory against the invaders.

I hope you will enjoy the game and feel free to provide feedback to improve it. Thank you!

Best Regards,
Anamik

news.title: Happy Father's Day
news.author: AmirBlack3
news.contents:
Fatherhood is a journey like no other, filled with precious moments and profound responsibilities. It's about being a guiding light, a source of support, and a role model for your children.
To all the fathers who have embraced the joys and challenges of parenthood, we salute you. Your unconditional love and sacrifices shape the lives of your children and leave an everlasting impact.
In honor of this special day, we invite you to experience the heartfelt journey of Fatherhood, an emotional indie game that explores the bond between a father and his child in the face of adversity.
Tag a dad who inspires you and let's celebrate the amazing fathers who make a difference in our lives. 💪❤️
#HappyFathersDay #FatherhoodGame #CelebratingDads

We are looking forward to see you!

news.title: Quick Announcement/Update about the eBook DLC...
news.author: Sciaenops Ocellatus
news.contents:
So the first big piece of news: yes, I'm working on it. For the first draft, I'm just porting all the lines over into a Word document and then reformatting them into something more bookish. From there, its just going to be revising and making it read like PROPER LITERATURE. Okay, maybe not "proper" on the lines of Sherlock Holmes or something. But more proper than it currently is.
But as I'm going through, I'm noticing a lot of lines that aren't as clear as when I first wrote the visual novel. Which is a normal process, I've learned. What reads great before doesn't read so well when you check on it months or years later. But the great thing about visual novels is that you can update them much easier than you can a published book. So while I am working on the novelization, I'm also revising the game.
So eventually, this game is going to get not only an eBook for DLC but it will get what I assume will be a fairly big update. Basically revising scenes from good to better. I'll come up with a kicky name for this update later.
No idea when either will release just yet, so stay tuned. :-)
(Also if you haven't checked out the sequel's demo yet, its still up and its still in Next Fest.
  LINK   So there you go, there's that.)

news.title: Some bugs and minor fixes
news.author: omainteractive
news.contents:
Fixed a bug where loading the game once with a vehicle spawned and then loading a save file with the vehicle spawned again would crash.
Some player buildings had walls that could be walked up like stairs using thin jaws.
now no longer allow players to walk up them like stairs.
(However, you can still stand on them if you jump up from another floor)
Fixed decals such as footprints not being created on crops
Changed the height of obstacles in front of the character that can be climbed with the chin to no longer respond to obstacles that are too low.
Fixed the animation of climbing over obstacles so that they don't bounce as much.
The duration of this behavior is now shorter than before
Other frame stability improvements related to light sources throughout the world
Fixed resetting on game restart after adjusting mouse sensitivity
Increased damage of melee weapons/tools, etc. and increased attack range to approximately 2-4 meters depending on weapon type.
Torch item durability increased

Reduced the amount of bullet spread when firearms are heavily low durability by about half

adjusted the collision for the explosive barrels so bullets hit it properly
made the arrows for the arrowfall card bigger

news.title: Upcoming Launch
news.author: Joshyposhytv
news.contents:
Greetings, everyone! Josh here,
I wanted to take a moment to share some exciting updates regarding The Secrets of Hope's development and its demo showcased during Steam Next Fest. The overwhelming support we received for the demo has been truly incredible, and I can't express my gratitude enough.
The demo offers just a glimpse of the captivating story and immersive experience that awaits you in The Secrets of Hope. The game's full release is scheduled for September 7th, 2023, exclusively on Steam.
We have deliberately chosen this release date to allow us to complete our ongoing Kickstarter Campaign successfully, which features some amazing rewards. Additionally, we want to finalize our marketing efforts and address a few minor development tasks. By doing so, we aim to ensure that the game's launch is nothing short of exceptional.
To foster a stronger connection with our community, we will be actively sharing more updates and crafting community-centric posts. I encourage all of you to join our Discord channel and follow us on all our social media platforms. We are eager to engage with you and build closer relationships within our community.
Thank you all for your continued support, and we eagerly anticipate the release of The Secrets of Hope.
   Join The Discord   
Best regards,
Josh

news.title: THE BEST GAME FROM THE BALTICS!
news.author: onionas1
news.contents:
Ready, Steady, Ship! emerged as a shining star at the Dev Gamm Game Expo, where it was nominated for and ultimately won the highly coveted "Best Game from Baltics" title. The event attracted numerous industry professionals, providing ample opportunities for networking, playtesting, and showcasing games. It was an exceptional experience that solidified Ready, Steady, Ship!'s position as an outstanding game within the Baltic game development community. Thanks, DevGamm!
More about the event:

news.title: Developer Play
news.author: sigma.indiegames
news.contents:
Play Cook Fest with all recipes & upgrades unlocked!
Feel the rush, chaos, and maze design technique from the dev itself ;)
Create and design your own complex maze by strategizing your festival spaces! Cook and serve dishes to satisfy your customers. Level up to unlock to new ingredients and recipes. With unexpected roguelite elements and fast-paced gameplay, you can play solo or in chaotic co-op with your fellow chef!
Cook Fest is a combination of strategic planning, restaurant management, tower defense, and chaotic kitchen action. It creates some fresh gameplay in the market and extremely fun roguelite experiences unlike any other.

Don't forget to wishlist it!

news.title: 🤘 Lets Break Some Glasses 🤘
news.author: Chisenoa
news.contents:
Hey everyone! We arranged a dev live stream in Next Fest. We'll be playing Lovux as it's developers. Join us!
Livestream link:
  LINK

news.title: Hardhat Wombat Live Stream with Plants vs Zombies creator, George Fan
news.author: All Yes Good
news.contents:
From the creator of Plants vs. Zombies, Hardhat Wombat is a cute puzzle-platformer construction game based on the most interesting fact in the world: wombats have cube-shaped poo. Doo-doo your best to deftly stack blocks of poo and complete increasingly perplexing constructions. Can you become number one at number two?
Puzzle and platform your way through 92 levels of poo-stacking fun!
Traverse through seven worlds, each with its own unique building material like vines made of broccoli and gum bubbles that float upward.
Encounter a variety of level types including brain-bending Dynamite levels and action-packed Beetle Hunt levels.
Unlock additional game modes including the Daily Gauntlet, where you can compete against other players for wombat pooping supremacy!

news.title: From Concept to Creation: Programancer Dev Log #3
news.author: ryan.rasing
news.contents:
Prison City's lead developer, Programancer, sits down to talk about the game's music, working with Retroware's testers, and why Hal uses a chakram!
Question #1: What did you envision for the music in the game? Did you take the inspiration from certain artists/games when it came to that? Also, what was it like working Raddland Studios and Matt Creamer?
Programancer: When I first started Prison City, I kept thinking about music from games like Street Fighter 2010 and Power Blade- a mix of high octane NES goodness and catchy melodies. I have been a huge fan of Matt Creamer's work since playing Retro City Rampage and I knew from the start that he was the only person I wanted to create music for this game! Working with him has been wonderful, and he knocks it out of the park with every track!
  
Question #2: Can you describe what it was like working with the testers at Retroware? What are some notable bugs you or the testers found that you're relieved to have resolved?
Programancer: They're the essential front lines of the bug war! It is so easy for bugs to slip through the cracks that developers would never find- we get so used to our games that we go through the motions as if it's just second nature- we can set out to test every possible thing those changes may have affected. The testers have been really awesome to work with and they've found things I absolutely never would have found on my own- and honestly, it's a huge relief every time a bug is found because it gives me an opportunity to dive into things I probably haven't touched in a while and fix them up- or in some cases make things better than they were before
  
As for a bug that I'm most relieved to have resolved is one where a certain NPC just idles on screen having a smoke after you're supposed to respawn from dying. While it was enjoyable to see that NPC have a nice relaxing break, it wasn't a whole lot of fun for the player!
Of course, there are some bugs I try to keep in, however, if they're helpful for speedrunners--and can only be triggered with a deliberate attempt--but that one just wasn't cutting it.
  
Question #3: Why did you decide to go with a chakram as the primary weapon for Hal? Did you consider other weapons prior to deciding on the chakram? Also, can you describe what it was like getting the chakram to work as desired/as in its current state in the game?
Programancer: The chakram was actually one of the first things I coded, and honestly I didn't have much time to consider another type of weapon when I started developing Prison City-
I knew that I didn't want to go with a gun and instead wanted to go a gun and instead wanted to go with something with a little more subtle nuance that didn't have unlimited range but could still be utilized in 8 directions. I've always been a big fan of Power Blade's boomerang, but I didn't want to go quite as far in that direction either- I did like the idea of a returning weapon though. I ended up looking to Xena for inspiration- Xena had a chakram and Xena is cool! The thing where the chakram returns to you with a different arc depending on which direction you're facing was inspired by Link's Awakening- where Link will swing his sword from different angles depending on what direction you're facing.
  
  
With all of that in, I knew the game would have to be designed almost entirely around the player's moveset and weapons, so I made sure there were some beneficial quirks to it- like for example: even though the chakram returns to the player after hitting a wall, it will still push through slightly so you can damage enemies or crates that are next to the wall it's hitting. In some cases, enemies will be positioned perfectly around the player, and if the player holds the attack button when throwing a chakram, it'll hang out in front of them for a while, and they can move it around them briefly. This was inspired by Castlevania 4's whipping mechanics!
  
That's all we've got this time! Check back for more updates!
Download and play the free Prison City demo now!

news.title: Watch as the solo GeoDepths developer plays his own demo
news.author: Matherno
news.contents:
Enjoy some gameplay of GeoDepths, my drill mining game that I have been working on for over a year part time, in between working a full time job and keeping up a social life XD.
This is just prerecorded gameplay, but feel free to join either of two scheduled livestreams for chats with the developer. Check out the livestream events on the store page for their times.

news.title: Reloading
news.author: [IT] highcla
news.contents:
Hey, everyone!
Considering the very positive reception of the idea on Discord, i'm implementing a reload system for all the weapons.
It wasn't there from the beginning, deliberately, to give EMPTY SHELL more of a "Quake" vibe, but the game is shaping up in a way that a reload system would fit nicely.
Some weapons (most of them) will work with mags, others (like the shotgun and the hunting rifle in the prologue, for example) will have single round reload (with a finite number of maximum rounds in the internal magazine).
Dodging, aiming, or melee strikes will interrupt the action, so keep a distance when reloading.
Also, reloading won't be automatic (shooting with an empty weapon with spare ammo won't reload), so keep an eye on the ammo counter!

news.contents:
Discover historic monuments with our puzzle game! With 20 incredible images and 5 levels of difficulty, this game will challenge your mind and take you on a journey through history. Test your skills in free mode or challenge mode. Play now and start exploring the world of historic monuments!

Release Date: June 22nd

[list]

  • 5 levels of difficulty for players of all skill levels

news.author: HOLYPERSON

LINK   We are excited to write down our first blog. We have been working on our game for a while and it will be
available for you to try on Steam Next Fest 19 June 2023.
You’ll also be able to join the developer stream on June 19th, 2023. We are humbled by your continuous support from day one.
Ojiv is a fast paced immersive rhytm game.

That’s enough for today’s blog, we would like to see all of you on Steam Next Fest. We can’t wait to bring the full version.

news.title: UPDATE: July 18th release date for Lachesis or Atropos
news.author: Quilliano
news.contents:
Quill Yuri is excited to announce we're publishing 4noki's horror mystery yuri visual novel, Lachesis or Atropos, on Steam.
We pushed the date on Valve's recommendation; the previous date had reduced algorithm visibility due to overlap with the Summer Sale. Thank you for the patience!
A private investigator visits a small town after recovering from a coma. She searches for her mentor's lost beloved, but the very eyes she was born with, those that can see the black strings of hate, drag her down into the darkness of conspiracy.
Out on July 18th, 2023. Wishlist on Steam now!
  LINK

news.title: Stand-Alone Dev Log #1
news.author: lifuelgames
news.contents:
Hello, this is Lifuel, developing Stand-Alone.
We've decided to start this development diary to share various challenges
we've faced in the process of developing Stand-Alone and the principles we adhere to.
We also hope to grow through your feedback and interactions.
We'll continue to share these development stories from time to time.
Today, I want to talk about 'Action'.
Stand-Alone is a pixel-graphic action roguelike game.
'Action' is an essential element in the roguelike genre,
and we believe it's a core appeal of the genre.
Therefore, we've put considerable thought into how to deliver high-quality action.
Our excellent team members are creating great pixel graphics and sprite animations,
focusing on stable controls, dazzling effects, natural camera movements, impactful skills,
and tension-filled battle designs.
Although discussing these technical aspects is important,
today, I'd like to talk about the topic that we've been primarily concerned with:
'Respecting the player's experience.'
Stand-Alone, borrowing the format of the roguelike genre, is a game
where players continually grow and challenge themselves,
acquiring and combining various skills through unpredictable enemies and events.
Therefore, we're striving to ensure that players can fully enjoy growing in different ways
and becoming stronger through their unique combinations and synergies.
However, we also understand that some players want to test their control skills without power-ups
and challenge themselves in 'challenge play'.
We believe that we should respect the demands of these challenging players,
and we welcome such challenges.

  

Hence, while developing the recent boss fight design,
we have considered how to make it challenging enough for skilled players to defeat the boss
without power-ups.
Not all players of Stand-Alone will choose or experience these elements.
However, we're striving to create an action roguelike game
where the constant challenges and player choices each carry their own meanings,
and these are connected to enjoyment.
We hope that each player's unique choices and play styles can lead to meaningful gaming experiences.
In this way, we're continuing the development of Stand-Alone,
valuing the players' choices and experiences.
We'll continue to work tirelessly to create a game that
fully brings out the charm of the action roguelike genre. :)!

We are actively communicating through Discord and Twitter,
so if you're curious about our team's updates or want to participate,
please join us through the link below.

Contact Us

news.title: 200623 Patch Notes
news.author: HalfwishDev69
news.contents:
- Changes:
- Tutorial Controls changed so that users can now interact with cards in Tutorial (Action Cards / Power / Adventure)
- Per game lamp limit changed as per requested
- Status Icons updated design (Overshield and Zen Stance)
- Increased the space for the mask for the portraits when using powers so lesser cutoff where possible
- Assassin able to get passive from evades again
- Changed Networking logic to properly reconnect if disconnected(Needs more testing especially when playing on different regions and high ping)
- Ice Beam Giving frozen status should not lock dv but instead snapshots the DV for the next roll
- Ignite No healing will last through out the entire round now
- Consecutive Parleys now give points once every 2 consecutive parleys now
- Bug Fixes:
- Fix for splashscreen video suddenly not playing when returning to main menu (Addition logic added to try check as often as possible to force video to resume if it ever detects the video is not running)
- Fixed a bug that caused math bar to show 0 defense
- Fixed a bug that caused feral strike's additional strike to not be shown in math bar
- Fixed a bug that cause scry to not parley thus making the game unable to continue
- Fixed a bug that made all adventure damage cards to not calculate with status
- Fixed a bug that made showdown card displays be misaligned
- Allowed status stacks to be seen in double digits(e.g having Juggernaut Shield + Zenstance giving the player 10 stacks of toughness)

news.title: Open Beta Is Online
news.author: momoStorm Entertainment
news.contents:
LINK   The open beta for ECB3 will begin on June 10th, 2023. After the beta is completed, the game will officially launch.
Qualifications for Participation:
This test is open to all players. No application is required.
How to Participate:
At this stage, the game is only available for download on Google Play. When the open beta test begins, search for “Epic Cards Battle 3” on the Google Play store and download the client. More platforms will be gradually added in the future.
Game Data:
Player data from the open beta will not be retained on the official server. The open beta server will continue to exist. Before each new version is officially launched, it will first be opened on the open beta test server.

news.title: Ver. 1.2.5 Addition of voice chat function
news.author: youdoyou.motto
news.contents:
Thank you for playing this game.
We are pleased to announce that we have added a voice chat function in the online play mode.
You can freely change the microphone on/off and connect/disconnect voice chat from the sound tab.
If you cannot hear the other player, please check the microphone settings on your computer.
Thank you for your patience, and we hope you enjoy the game after the update.

news.title: Celebrate with new arrivals, download the "TraceTheLight" Demo！
news.contents:
Celebrate with new arrivals, download the "TraceTheLight" Demo！


Warmly celebrate the arrival of the Steam New Product Festival in June 2023, come and explore the grand world of "Trace the Light"! Download the demo now and join us in celebrating Steam's grand event. We can't wait to see what you do in the game.
   Click here to download the demo!    

  

During the new product festival, share your views with us


During the Steam New Product Festival, we arranged a live broadcast for developers to let everyone know more about the content and wonderful experience of the game. After watching the live broadcast or experiencing the demo, if you are interested in "Light Walk", you are welcome to add the game to your wish list, and you can also click the link below to join the official player exchange group and share your suggestions and ideas with us!

  

Follow-up development and improvement


Participating in the Steam New Product Festival is a memorable moment for "Light Journey", which means that our efforts have achieved phased results. As a development team, we certainly hope that the game can be released to everyone as soon as possible, but at the same time, we also know that the completion of the game at this stage is still low, and it still takes a long time to polish the upper limit of the official version of the game. During this period, we welcome any suggestions or BUG feedback on the game, please let us make the game better together!
   Click here to join the official player exchange group: 434276599   

  

  LINK   [/url]

news.title: Theorie und Wishlist
news.author: grooviak
news.contents:
Werte Beuteltierfans,
das Känguru-Game hat vor 6 Monaten das Licht der Welt erblickt, und diesen halben Geburtstag möchten wir feiern - und zwar mit dem bisher höchsten Rabatt! Endlich gibt es das Game hier auf Steam für knapp 5 Euro.
Ja ja, ich weiß, was ihr denkt: 5 Euro, das sind 10 Mark, das sind 20 Ostmark, das sind 100 Ostmark auf dem Schwarzmarkt … Aber schaut euch einfach mal die Rezensionen an und wieviel Spielzeit die Leude da so abgerissen haben; das ist doch verdammt viel Känguru-Spaß für nen schmalen Taler. Wer ab und zu mal in unseren Discord reinschaut, weiß auch, dass das Game leider bisher nicht gerade die Kasse zum Klingeln gebracht hat - im Gegenteil hat es noch nicht mal die Mindestsumme erreicht, die man auf Steam umsetzen muss, damit das Spiel Trading Cards und Community-Gegenstände haben darf. Erkennt man übrigens an dem mysteriösen Hinweis "Profilfunktionen eingeschränkt" rechts in der Feature-Liste auf der Steamseite.
Dabei könnte es so einfach sein: Wenn alle, die das Game auf der Wishlist haben, es jetzt kaufen würden, dann hätten wir die Summe ruckzuck erreicht. Und mal ehrlich: Wer hätte nicht gerne digitale Sammelkarten vom Känguru, Marc-Uwe, Krapotke, Herta und den ganzen anderen Haudegen? Und dazu schnuckelige Hintergründe, Rahmen, animierte Profilbilder und Badges mit den besten Rängen eines gewissen hierarchiefreien Geheimbunds?!?
Also macht es wie die vom Boxclub und … schlagt zu!
Die erste und zweite Regel des Boxclubs gilt hingegen nicht; falls ihr das Game selbst schon habt, dann redet unbedingt ständig und ganz viel darüber. Quatscht das Ding den Leuten auf, zwingt sie zum antiterroristischen Glück - Lasst die Theorie zur Praxis werden und bringt das Kapital zurück in die Hände der hart ackernden Arbeiterklasse … und damit meine ich UNS hier bei
TUNERMAXX ːDottieJoyː

news.title: Leak. We're live streaming for the Steam Festival! Join us.
news.author: rezunovevgeny
news.contents:
You work in a small laboratory for water research, enjoying a quiet and peaceful life you have with your wife and son.
Everything changes when Refleaktion Corporation becomes its new owner.
  
Having to make decisions that go against your morality, you keep telling yourself your lifelong project will result in a discovery that does more good than harm.
But there is a limit to everything.
Soon you find out that the next step in your research is conducting experiments on people. You quit your job in order to escape to the countryside with your family and clear yourself of suspicion.
Except when you return home your wife and son are missing, and there is a corpse of an unknown man hanging from a ceiling in your study.
Get ready for it is just the beginning.
  
Immerse yourself in the world of Leak, where science meets rituals. Feel the fine line between hope and despair. Live out the story of a man who does the unthinkable in hopes to return to his normal life.
Resist the spirits that have entered our world in the form of pure agony and nightmares.
  
Be the first to get the latest news! Links to our social media can be found on our website. There we share news about the game development process and exciting new materials.
We look forward to you joining our community!

news.title: Steam Next Fest Demo Now Available!
news.author: Fiction Factory Games
news.contents:
It's time! Load your grappling gun and give your hacker cat some treats, because we're stealing a national monument!
Play the one-caper demo of Penny Larceny today -- and don't forget to wishlist the game, to help us fight THE ALGORITHM(tm)! Our visibly during Next Fest can be improved by you clicking one little button!
(Also technically the event officially starts in a few hours, but we wanted to get the demo up early to make sure everything was A-OK and nothing was on fire.)
And throughout Next Fest, we'll have a looping video playing through the demo with the lead developer and content creator JellyCrowned! You could just watch that instead of playing yourself, but maybe do both? I mean, it's just a suggestion. Whatever, I'm not your dad.
See you on Crimr!

news.title: Charity Auction for It Returned to the Desert Physical Collector's Edition
news.author: tim.rachor
news.contents:
Hello everyone,
I wanted to let you know that I've started a charity auction on eBay for the Collector's Edition of the game. There are only 5 in existence and they are not being sold elsewhere.
All proceeds will go to the UN Refugee Aid.
You can find the auction with all the details here:
  LINK   International shipping is available.
Please spread the word! ːsteamhappyː

news.title: Preparation of the demo version for the publication
news.author: Effect Studio
news.contents:
Hello friends, subscribers and fans of the LE project, the development progress is gaining momentum, recently there has been active work on the client for the demo version, where you will have access to a lot of items, weapons, drones and robots, crafting, resources, etc. A huge cave with a lot of monsters and a boss, a fortification base, merchants and all ready-made mechanics databases at the time of the demo version. A lot of quests and tasks, hidden places and interesting characters, acquaintance with the commanders of the base, with its history and problems. Every day, locations are being developed and supplemented, new items are being added in parallel and the list of possible crafting, creation or processing of any items is expanding. Below I will attach a video of a brief overview of the base and gameplay, and you, dear friends, subscribe to the channel, add the game to what you want in the incentive, and if you want to help the project and its development, there are opportunities for various donations, do not forget about our discord on the development of the Life Effect project.
With respect to you LE and good mood.

news.title: Update 19.06
news.author: NeverSayNever
news.contents: Update

news.title: The bestselling NTR series, " My Neighbor's Lonely Wife", is getting back-to-back releases at the end of this month with English localization!
news.author: Chet
news.contents:
My Neighbor's Lonely Wife 2



After moving to a new house, your stunningly beautiful neighbor, Haruka Aoi, quickly greets you. She’s 28 and lives together with her husband of six years. On top of her graceful beauty, she also has a very charming personality. However, she doesn’t seem to have any friends in the neighborhood…

Chat with Haruka and slowly deepen your relationship. There will be no force, hypnotism, or anything of the sort involved as you befriend her and seduce your way into her lonely heart.

  
  

My Neighbor's Lonely Wife



A married couple recently moved into the apartment next door. While the husband’s never home due to work, you start developing a crush on his wife, Niiyama Akiho. Spend time with Akiho, comfort her, and steal her affection!

  
  

【Add to wishlist】



Mango Party offers high-quality localized translations, allowing both new and old players to immerse themselves in the intricate storyline crafted by Yasaniki. “My Neighbor's Lonely Wife “ will be released on June 24th, and “My Neighbor's Lonely Wife 2” will be released on June 28th. Stay tuned and I look forward to it!

  LINK     LINK   
You may also like the following:

[hr][/hr]

Sexy Room



  

You are reunited with an old college senpai, Vanessa Lee. The two of you used to be inseparable before you parted ways and lost contact with her. While catching up with each other's lives, you learn that she got married...

That sends you tumbling into a pit of despair, but before you know it, you are teleported to a room by a higher power: A room that the two of you can only leave AFTER you have sex. Not wanting to be trapped forever, you and Vanessa do the deed.

Imagine your surprise when you and Vanessa are teleported again and again, day after day, into this mysterious room. Is it a prank by a higher power, or are they just fulfilling your wishes?

  

【Add to wishlist】



  LINK   
Follow us!
[hr][/hr]
        
[list] [*]    Steam Publishr Page    [*]    Twitter     [*]    Facebook     [*]    Discord     [/list]
Mango Party: Bringing awesome hentai games to you.
]

news.title: ToT Version 1.02
news.author: newtales.info
news.contents:
Dragon bug fixed
Minor bugs/glitches fixed
Taevan Fight (Exitum): reduced Taevan Hp regen
Kelcie added to the Dream Room (endgame)
Minor translation errors fixed (ita-eng)
